subject: Public Speaking
title: The Blushing Paradox
description: A 60-second lesson on The Blushing Paradox.

hook.text: Your face turns red on stage. Now you're embarrassed about being embarrassed. The blush deepens.

buildup.text: Blushing is unique to humans. Darwin called it the most peculiar expression because it can't be voluntarily controlled.

discovery.text: Research shows blushing actually makes you more likable. People trust blushers more because it signals honesty.

twist.text: The harder you try to suppress a blush, the worse it gets. Fighting it activates more sympathetic arousal.

climax.text: The paradox: the symptom you fear most actually makes your audience like you more. Vulnerability builds trust.

punchline.text: Blushing says you care. Audiences respect that.

quiz.question: What does research show about blushing?
options: It actually increases likability and trust
